alert.note: Alert for Dorado; Manati; Vega Alta; Vega Baja (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 27 at 2:20PM ADT until October 27 at 5:30PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Dorado County in Puerto Rico... Manati County in Puerto Rico... Vega Alta County in Puerto Rico... Vega Baja County in Puerto Rico... * Until 430 PM AST. * At 120 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Vega Baja, Vega Alta, Manati, Dorado, Toa Baja, Barceloneta, Toa Alta, Ceiba, Monserrate, Miranda, Coto Norte, Brenas, La Luisa, Rio Lajas, San Antonio, Sabana, Tierras Nuevas Poniente and Tierras Nuevas Pon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Dorado; Manati; Vega Alta; Vega Baja
